articles.description: Owing to pandemic-led disruptions, the process has been delayed for quite a long time now, therefore, the govt has decided to provide a fresh push to privatisation of state-run banks and insurance companies.
articles.content: The government is likely to conclude the privatisation process of state-run companies that are in the pipeline after facing a setback over the sale of state-run oil refiner by the end of this fiscal.… [+1025 chars]

articles.title: Crypto Tax Regime: Terra Investors In India Face Double Whammy - NDTV Profit
articles.description: Terra investors around the world lost billions of dollars when the algorithmic-stablecoin project crashed but they recovered a small part of their bets when a new token was distributed as compensation. Investors in India arent as fortunate.
articles.content:
Luna 2.0 started trading on May 28.

articles.title: I'm not worried about protectionism: Prem Watsa, Chairman, Fairfax Financial Holdings - Economic Times
articles.description: He believes the welfare programs of the present government and their scale and reach have improved opportunities for the average Indian. He argues that there has also been a positive shift in attitudes towards business and wealth creators.

articles.title: Rupee depreciation, reforms, returns pull NRIs towards Indian real estate - Economic Times
articles.description: The rising interest from NRI homebuyers is being witnessed across segments, from mid-income projects to premium and luxury segments and plotted developments.
articles.content:
Depreciation of the rupee against the dollar in the backdrop of the geopolitical situation and hardening global interest rates is helping drive sales of real estate to non-resident Indians.
